channel.title: This will sound so noobish but
channel.description: What is the byte/w/e key to press enter as I have looked on the table we were given in the scar help guide and I can't see it

item.title: This will sound so noobish but
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Right so you got everything now?
Just make a new topic for anything else

What Doggie said was right, to Drag the mouse just hold it down where you start and lift it up where you end,
Make sure you don’t release it in the same place you started it
I think I’ve done that before XD.

Could always do this:

procedure MouseDown(Left: Boolean);
var
  X, Y: Integer;
begin
  GetMousePos(X, Y);
  HoldMouse(X, Y, Left);
end;

procedure MouseUp(Left: Boolean);
var
  X, Y: Integer;
begin
  GetMousePos(X, Y);
  ReleaseMouse(X, Y, Left);
end;

So you can do,

begin
  MoveMouse(100, 100);
  MouseDown(True);
  MoveMouse(500, 500);
  MouseUp(True);
end.

instead of

begin
  MoveMouse(100, 100);
  HoldMouse(100, 100, True);
  MoveMouse(500, 500);
  ReleaseMouse(500, 500, True);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: This will sound so noobish but

item.title: This will sound so noobish but
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

[quote=“scar help guide”]procedure HoldMouse(x, y: Integer; Left: Boolean);
Holds mouse button. Set parameter Left to true for left button, false for right.

procedure ReleaseMouse(x, y: Integer; Left: Boolean);
Releases mouse button. Set parameter Left to true for left button, false for right.[/quote]

just:
holdmouse(x,y,true)
movemouse(x1,y1)
releasemouse(x1,y1,true)

Read full topic
item.source: This will sound so noobish but

item.title: This will sound so noobish but
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Ascii Code for Enter is 13
So you could use,
KeyDown(13);
or
SendKeys(‘Words’ + Chr(13)); //Chr(13) = Enter

Read full topic
